CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 18, 1959, pg. 28, reads: "Negro Players Charge They're Snubbed In Invitational Tennis Tourney Play - Should Play in Invitational Tourneys - Veteran and top ranking tennis players, like those above charge that although permitted to play in public parks' meets, never have they been invited to play in local invitational tournaments, even though many of their white opponents, whom they have defeated, are so honored. Some of these stalwarts, like Bill Colbert, flashy court stylists, are highly seeded among Western Pennsylvania netters and give a good account of themselves with the racquet.  All of the above are members of the Schenley Park tennis team...  in right photo are three of the women stars on the team.  Left to right: Barbara Thompson, Elaine Rosen and Marion Davis.  Not shown in the picture are members Jackie Douglass and Ray Brown. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of women on Schenley Park Tennis Team, from left: Barbara Thompson (Mason), Elaine Rosen, and Marion Davis, posed around net on tennis court
